fields.Title of Presentation: Masters of Genetics Counseling Students in an online program participated in a real-time telehealth simulation with a Standardized Patient
fields.Conference / Meeting Name: National League of Nursing Education Summit
fields.Description/Abstract:
Online learning environments limit the types of educational delivery for students in a clinical
program of study. While online students may participate in screen-based and computerized simulations,
they do not usually do not practice with Standardized Patients or high fidelity manikins in laboratory or
simulation facilities. In this study, a nursing simulationist will collaborate with genetic counseling faculty
members to develop a telehealth simulation using Standardized Patients for online masters of genetics
counseling students.
Genetic Counseling is generally taught in a face-to-face environment, but the program at Xxxx
University is the first accredited online Masters of Genetic Counseling program in the nation. Face to
face genetic counseling programs often utilize Standardized Patients for practice encounters. It is
becoming increasingly common for patients to receive health treatment and information in a telehealth
session, therefore, it seems natural for online students to practice counseling through this modality.
Nursing and genetic counseling faculty will explore whether online telehealth simulations with
Standardized Patients can help prepare online Masters of Genetic Counseling students for field training.
Each student will have a 40-minute online telehealth genetic counseling session with a patient newly
diagnosed with breast cancer, followed by 5-10 minutes of feedback from the Standardized Patient.
After the session, small groups of students will participate together in an online real-time debriefing.
After the debriefing, but before field training begins, students will be surveyed electronically
about the simulation experience. Students will complete the survey again after field training begins.
Quantitative answers will analyzed utilizing paired t-tests. Text based short answers will also be
compared. The Xxxx IRB has approved this research project.
This project will provide data to determine whether simulated telehealth activities should be
continued or expanded in online education programs. If successful, the technique could provide support
for utilization in other types of online programs.
